course.subject: IEDA
course.name: Engineering Management
course.description: Techniques relating to modeling and analysis and management of engineering operations; productivity assessment and improvement, quality assessment and improvement; principles of behavioral science and its application to engineering management.

reviews.author: Alexwww
reviews.title: Overall decent but if you simply want to get good grade then go to CHEM1004
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction
2. Project Management
3. Product and Service Design
4. Process Selection and Facility Layout
5. Quality Management
6. Forecasting
7. Location Analysis
8. Inventory Management
9. Aggregate Planning
10. MRP and JIT
They are useful contents overall, and I do think I have got a better insight into the principles business world around us and have learned something I could have never known of. Not a business student so cannot say much about whether the contents would still be used in the real world today, but they are inspiring to some extent.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor QIU Xuan has really good Engligh accent. She also raise questions in class so there is good interaction.

As i said the professor might assume that the content is easy enough to understand, and without any business background I felt lost from time to time. For this course the most important thing is to really understand all the concepts and make quick reaction to calculations. The calculation stuffs are really based on intuition instead of math, so if you don't understand all those formula i suggest you treat them as application problems in your middle school math.(like what you would see in Inventory Management)
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Homework
5% participation (in class polling)
20% project
30% midterm
35% final exam

The grading was not thaaat good as some of the previous reviews said, but it is not as competitive as other reviews said either. Only being eligible to view some of the reviews at the beginning of the semester, I thought this course is the somewhat light-hearted, blow-water and everyone can get good grade very easily (You see, people on USTSPACE can't always be reliable! Many of them write review simply because they got A+ and might simply want to show off a bit). With this mindset i chose the class and clearly I ended up wrong. It might be because i have no business background at all so sometimes i felt really lost in the class and it was really painful. So if you simply want to improve your CGA, go to CHEM1004, where you may get even better result with same effort. (just personal opinion lol)
I got about 1sd above mean in the midterm and only 71/100 in the final. FINE i have no idea why i lost so many marks in final, and there was time i thought i would end up B range. I still secure a marginal A range in the end though. Still somewhat lenient.
reviews.comment_workload:
Relatively low, as I hardly spend time dealing with the course material. I did take serious review before the midterm so i can say that i master some of the contents like Forecasting. but I skipped or slept over some of the classes in the final season because i couldn't keep up or i was busy with other courses. For concepts i didn't know i simply took a glimps and enhanced the understanding only days before final exam. I wasn't taking the course too serously so my grade seems matching.
Homework works well with excel, but never be depedent on it, as you are required to do everything by hand in exams after all.
For concepts you don't understand, try to watch recording or ask TA in the tutorial and treat in-class exercise seriously.

reviews.author: ogt
reviews.title: Overall good
reviews.comment_content:
Content is as explained in the other reviews. The most complicated topics were probably the chapters from forecasting onwards:
1 Introduction
2 Project Management
3 Product and Service Design
4 Process Selection and Facility Layout
5 Quality Management
6 Forecasting
7 Location Analysis
8 Inventory Management
9 Aggregate Planning
10 MRP and JIT

I'm not sure whether the content is very useful in the long run for non-IEDA majors but provides a better understanding of these topics that many businesses rely on. A good first year engineering course I guess.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very professional and nice. Her English was very good. This semester was completely ONLINE and I think she did a good job explaining the material. Quite fast-paced for some topics.

Tutorial content is very useful and well designed, it isn't necessary to attend but do try going through them before exams. The TA was very responsive to a few questions I had through email.

Project: Scores were not handed out
It covered topics from forecasting to the end (non-cumulative).

My final grade was a B, a bit disappointing actually because I had worked quite hard for the final. For the final, when calculating inventory total cost don't forget to add the actual cost of each item at the end... :)
reviews.comment_workload:
Pretty good. Homeworks take anywhere from 2 to 4 hours. Midterm and final require practicing, there are plenty of exercises available (tutorial content + exercises from lectures + additional exercises).

Project is fairly lightweight, I was in a group of 5 where everyone cooperated. The project is due towards the end of the semester where everyone is quite busy though.

Project guidelines:
Start up a small business which makes and sells food in HKUST campus.
Specifically, your group has to:
o Develop your competitive strategy;
o Design your products;
o Conduct demand forecasting of your products;
o Develop inventory management policy (and/or MRP)
Other issues can be also considered, e.g. analyze the location, determine product price, estimate revenue and operating costs, and project annual financial return from your investment.

Project was interesting but in my opinion, most groups are doing the same things, so I expect it is probably quite hard to differentiate yourself through the project.

reviews.author: MANSI
reviews.title: A quite easy course
reviews.comment_content:
L1 Introduction (with some basic concepts about engineering management)
L2 Product & Service Design
L3 Project Management*
L4 Process Selection & Layout Design*
L5 Quality Management
L6 Forecasting*
L7 Location Planning
L8 Inventory Management*
L9 Aggregate Planning
L10 MRP (Materials Requirements Planning) & JIT (Just-In-Time)

Basically the calculations in the sections are so easy, just simple addition, subtraction and multiplication. L3 & L4 only require students to understand some diagrams. However, the most challenging part is the logical flow of the charts and diagrams. However, it is still not as hard as the comp courses so most students are capable about that.
reviews.comment_teaching: I can feel that the professor is passionate and she will try her best to answer the questions from students. However, her tone was a little bit dull and she would read the ppt directly for most of the times... But don't skip lessons because there are quizzes!
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 10% (3 homework)
Class participation 5% (There are drop quizzes, in total 2)
Project 15%
Mid-term 30%
Final 40%

Many people say that this course is good grade is because the course materials are so simple but I think the grading is normal

Homework:
You need to submit a hard copy to the prof's mailbox. It is a great chance to check your logic about that chapter. Better discuss with your classmate/ group mate before submitting the homework.

Class participation:
The quizzes are quite hard but it is open-note. You can also ask the professor. She is very willing to answer your questions ahaa.

Project:
For my semester, we are required to set up a business plan for a new food shop on-campus. We need to develop our marketing strategy, design our products and try to use the theories taught to show the store's operation management and profitability.

Mid-term:
Covers L1 to L6

Final:
All chapters but the focus will be on L7 to L10.

My grade:

I nearly got full mark on the homework and quizzes. However, my project presentation is not that satisfactory. You may need to use some out-syllabus theories to show your business' profitability. And our group failed to use them.... So the numbers in our presentation are quite strange. Although the professor didn't give us back the result but I bet it's not that good.

Mid-term:
30% MC 70% Written Question
My result: 89.5/100 (Above 1 SD)
As I've said, the calculations are so easy. However, for that kind of course the questions will be so deep. You need to recite the lecture notes so precisely and carefully. You can answer some MC questions by your common sense though.

Final:
30% MC, 70% Long question
And finally I got an A-

The professor didn't release the result but I bet it's not that good coz I totally did not understand one of the long question which worth 10 or 15 points. However, you can get good result by doing all the exercises and samples coz the professor may make a little change and put them on the exam questions directly haha!
reviews.comment_workload:
You don't really need to study before the mid-term coz there are no complicated calculations before it. If you can understand the logic then that's enough for the first half of the course. However, you need to attend lessons after lessons after mid-term since the course materials are way more difficult, especially the lectures about Inventory Management.

In terms of the project, it is quite a simple project so do more research about it and that will be ok.

reviews.author: SQ Flyer
reviews.title: OM with some engineering applications & Decent Grade :) QX好耶 Grading 合理
reviews.comment_content:
This is a compulsory IE / CC-S&T course. The course involves the fundamental concepts & applications of engineering management and operations. It is highly recommended for both Business and Engineering students who have difficulties enrolling in a proper S&T CC course. Business students should find the course easy, just because the course is very similar to another business course, ISOM 2700 OM, covering similar content.
Civil Engineering students should find some chapters are easy, since some contents are covered in CIVL 2160 & 2170.
____________________________________________________
Course Detail: (Calculations with asterisks*)

Midterm:
1. Introduction to Operation Management
2. Product and Service Design
3. *Project Management* (CPM/PERT/Activity Crashing)
4. *Process and Facility Layout* (Line Balancing , GPW/GNFT, efficiency,idle time, min. workstations etc.)
5. Quality Management
6. *Demand Forecasting* (MAD, MAPE, MSE, Linear Regression, Naive Method, Moving Average, Exponential Smoothing, Holt' Exponential Smoothing, Holt-Winters Method)
____________________________________________________
Final
7. *Location Planning and Analysis* (Single Facility Allocation Model)
8.*Inventory Management* (EOQ, EPQ Model, Reorder point, Quantity Discount Model, Newsvendor Model, critical ratio, Safety stock, Continuous review policy QR Model etc.)
9.*Aggregate Planning* (Level, Chase, Mixed strategies, MPS)
10.*MRP and JIT* (MRP and MPS)
____________________________________________________
The course covers quite a lot calculations, but once you understand well how them work in different scenarios and the procedures, you will be very fine with the aid of cheat-sheet during exams.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This is a IE and CC(S&T) course, with both lecture and tutorial included.

Dr. Qiu is a young (about 30) and responsible lecturer from Mainland. Unlike most Mainland professors in UST, she doesn't have strong and typical accent, which facilitates her to deliver the lecture content clearly to students from diverse background.

She is able to point out the lecture content with adequate interactions. However, personally speaking, I think students should pay much attention when she is going to cover the calculations of different models, which are demanding and quite hard to understand completely in first sense. Please joint down the calculation procedures and logic from the whiteboard displayed in the classroom, which are helpful for further revision and completing the assignments.Sometimes she gives additional examples which are not included in the lecture notes, better copy them and take photos. For other course content without involving calculations, you can just listen and figure out the key points from the lecture notes, which are essential for preparing the MC questions in both exams.

For the tutorials, we have 4 tutorials this semester. Flora Chang, the TA, is very helpful. She provides more additional examples for  the calculation problems in different topics, pointing out the techniques and procedures involved, as a supplement to the lectures.

Just feel free to raise questions to both lecturer and TA, they are willing to answer and give additional explanations.
reviews.comment_grading:
Marking rubics:
Assignments * 3 (All are calculations) 15%
Pop up Quizzes(Class Participation) *2 5%
Group project (Presentation and report) 15%
Mid Term 30%
Final 40%

Once you finish the requirements with quality work, the grading is very fair. Exams are not really difficult, but you better be careful with the calculations with clumsy steps. If you are able to do the calculations well and have great cheat-sheet for the MC questions, everything is very fine.

Paper-Setting:
15 MC questions (30%)
3-5 Calculation Problems (70%)

My Result:
Assignments nearly full mark
Pop Quizzes full mark
Group project (result not released,should be above mean)
Mid Term 82/100 (mean=71,above around 1 SD)
Final (result not released, should be above mean since final is more challenging)

Personal Grade: A-
Turns out the grade is reasonable if you work hard for this course and probably an A is possible if performance of mid-term is exceptionally high.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is slightly heavy when you need to prepare for the project presentation (15-20 mins) and report (6-8 pages) . The project requires your group to design a new food business in UST campus,applying the techniques and contents covered in this course. You should ensure your group members are cooperative and able to hand in quality work, especially the calculations and design of operation strategies.  

After lectures and tutorials, you should spend some time reviewing the calculations and the mathematical models, since they are complex when you learn those models first time, better jot some notes and 口訣. Once you understand and master the techniques, you can just work on the assignments and preparing for the exams very well.

If you don't revise regularly, you will be like someone who always complain you are studying toxic jj

reviews.comment_teaching:
My decision to swap CHEM1004 with this is full of regrets. Qiu Xuan is a super lazy professor.

1. Explains very roughly without much explanation, but just directly speaks out the slides. Concepts are not presented well and goes straightly into homework. At least just give more exercises so that we can hone our skills.

2. Very slow response on email questions. Responds at most once per week, if any. In fact, she sometimes skips enquiries and only reply selectively, even if I'm not asking stupid questions,

3. powerpoint slides have meagre explanation of concepts. For example, the newsboy problem has poor presentation of several approaches. When she explains roughly on approach A (marginal analysis), she suddenly do an example which about approach B (payoff table). This is horrible with a lack of organisation of powerpoint slides.
reviews.comment_grading: Overall: B+. To me, finals is harder. I got 8X on midterm but only 6X on finals, which is vice versa of other peers.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not that much - regular homework assignments that helps consolidate knowledge as well as project.

Homework is a great way to know your weaknesses and to ask your peers (yes, your peers. lecturer and tutor are unhelpful)

As for homework, strongly suggest you cross-check with your friends to prevent careless mistakes since homework mean is usually high.

reviews.title: Don't underestimate the power of the people studying in this course
reviews.comment_content:
Long story short, this is a business operations course made for engineering students. If you don't have a particular interest in business operations and such, you will not enjoy this course. The arithmatic mainly concerns quite simple discrete math, and the key factor to acing its exams are preparing good cheat sheets xD Remember to spend more time to prepare better ones.

From syllabus: "The objective of this course is to introduce a broad overall  understanding and training in scientific management of business activities in producing goods and services. Throughout the course emphasis will be placed on how to use scientific management techniques to improve cost, quality, market timing as introducing  product and service for a company. Topics in the course will focus on project management, product/service design, production planning and management, quality management and supply chain management."

reviews.author: bbbbb
reviews.title: Relatively Easy among S&T CC
reviews.comment_content:
Content covered this semester:
1 Introduction
*2 Project Management (project life cycle, project planning, critical path analysis)
3 Product and Service Design
*4 Process Selection and Facility Layout (Process types, different types of layouts, line balancing)
*5 Quality Management (DPMO, Quality tools)
*6 Forecasting (Forecasting methods)
*7 Location Analysis (Making location decisions)
*8 Inventory Management (ABC analysis, EOQ, EPQ, newsboy problem, etc.)
*9 Aggregate Planning (level capacity/chase demand strategy)
*10 MRP and JIT (Product structure, MRP processing)

Contents are relatively easy to understand compared with other S&T common core. Details are included above for each chapter. You may google it if you want to take this course.

Calculations are easy. What you have to do is just substituting the number into the given formula. Topics with * need to do calculations. Not hard to understand even if you aren't seng/sci students.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring lecture. Attendance is not required. Lecture videos are provided this semester so you can x2 the speed.
Prof's English is not bad, at least she isn't with heavy mainland accent.

There are 5 tutorials this semester. Some examples are provided. However, I think the TA doesn't explain clearly. So I usually skip the tutorial. You may send an email to TA to ask questions about HW. However, some TAs are not very responsive.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework = 9.875/10
Project = 25%
Midterm Exam = 30/30
Final Exam = 35%

The mean is quite high for both hw & midterm. Project & final exam results are not released. Final grade is A.

Midterm format: 1.5 hrs, 20 MCs & 3 Long Q with calculations.
Final format: 2 hrs, 15 MCs & 5 Long Q with calculations.
Prof said you have to provide clear steps in the calculations, which is very time-consuming during the exam. But overall it isn't hard ( a bit harder than HW but still acceptable as long as your concept is clear)

The grade is not as good as expected. The mean is high and SD is quite small. 2-3 marks in the exam may fall into a different subgrade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is light if you have good groupmates.
Homework: 4 HW in total. Usually, 1 week will be given for you to finish it. Each HW takes you about 1-2 hours to review the notes and calculate the answers.

Project: develop a business strategy to sell sth in HKUST
I believe that more than 50% of students in this course are from Seng year 1. If you are not fm and you don't want to do projects with fm, please find someone to take this course with you. Otherwise, you may find it hard to work on the project as they may not perform as you expect.
As the project topic is easy, people propose similar ideas. If you want a good grade, make sure you go into details in the project with clear calculations. You may also work harder on the PowerPoint as some other groups have poor presentation slides.

reviews.author: Kevin KAI
reviews.title: HIGH RECOMMENDATION 我會推薦比全部frd嘅一個course
reviews.comment_content:
前期教嘅係一D基本嘅邏輯推論，上堂有公式同埋教你點樣用，所以好容易跟到。
後期開始教嘅野係operation management， 同ISOM2700有交叉嘅concepts，計數相對麻煩D。
好多人講呢個course同isom2700好似，的確係咁，但係勒，我覺得兩者之間交叉部分應該得50%到，另外D野係新嘅同埋based on ISOM嘅更多拓展。
reviews.comment_teaching:
QIU XUAN is a good teacher.
She didn't just teach us the concepts and formula, but she will also help us to analysis some example questions, tell us the calculation steps one by one and how to use the formula. So after her teaching, we can have deepen understanding of the formula. So I don't feel that I have some confusion on solving the problems. Her lecture is useful than tutorial class.
I was also taking ISOM 2700 in this semester, I feel that if I have some concepts I cannot understand in ISOM 2700, I could totally understand by her teaching. SO GOOD!
However, there is one problem: Her speed is toooooo fast!!! sometimes she just finish her 1.5 hr lecture in 1 hour. We calculate that she almost finished one slide in 20 sec hahahaha. But if you don't understand and ask her some questions, she can explain more clearly and slowly. So just feel free to ask, she is a good teacher.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade course
Consists of class participation, homework, project, midterm and final.
Class participation is about some in-class quiz and class activities. She did it randomly, you won't know when you should do. But the quiz is super easy, you can finish it in 10 minutes and get full marks.
There are only three homework in this semester. The homework is easy because she have calculation steps and example questions in the ppt. Also, if you have source, you will not have problems on that. The mean is high, always 97/100.
The midterm is not so difficult. You have cheat sheet but seems useless. The formula is useful but you don't know how to prepare for the mc questions about concepts. I did well in long questions but always lose marks in mc. So what you can do is not just make a good cheat sheet, but you should also understand the concepts.
The final is not so easy wor, because the time is limit but the long questions need many steps. So I feel that I don't have enough time to finish it well.
The project is not difficult, because you don't need to do some survey or other things, what you should do is to use her formula and analysis your business. It is called 紙上談兵.
MY RESULT: My class participation is full mark. My homework results are 97/100, 100/100 and 100/100, the means are all 97/100. My midterm is 89/100, the mean is around 76 and sd is around 13, I forget hahaha, but I know I don't beyond one sd. I don't know my project and final result. Finally I get A. SO GOOD !!!!1
reviews.comment_workload:
Not homework stress for me.
Every month to finish a homework, taking 2 hours to do it. But it is not difficult.
And then is project. It is a teamwork, everyone just spend some time after the midterm and then you can finish a good job.

reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grade.

mean: B
above within 1 sd: A range

Midterm exam: 79.5/100 (mean: around 72/100, sd around 18)

Final exam: not sure (with 14.5 marks deducted and a big cross on the last question) (no mean released)

group project(15 mins presentation): didn't release the score

reviews.comment_workload:
Very light.

One homework every 2 weeks, can be completed within 1 hour.

Make sure you attend most lectures as you won't know which lecture would have a pop-up quiz. I didn't attend most lectures and that's why I missed the quiz.

Basically, you don't need to revise anything before the exam, just reviewing lecture notes quickly and completing those tutorial questions again would guarantee a good score (at least above mean).

Remember to spend more time on group-project and never be a deadline fighter. Better to start working on it as soon as possible, as the presentation date might collide with final exams.
